3. anterior visual pathways - This term refers to the nerve fibers that transmit visual information from the eye to the brain. Damage to these pathways can lead to visual impairment or loss. Although not a disease per se, damage to the anterior visual pathways can be a symptom or consequence of various diseases.
4. peripheral nerves - These are the nerves that transmit signals between the central nervous system (the brain and spinal cord) and the rest of the body. Damage to peripheral nerves can result in various neurological symptoms, such as numbness, tingling, or weakness. Peripheral neuropathy is the term used to describe damage to the peripheral nerves.
